info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 9 at 4:26PM CDT until June 9 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Escambia.
* WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 425 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Atmore, Brewton, McCullough, East Brewton, Pollard, Riverview, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21, I65 And CR 1, Poarch Creek Reservation, Foshee, Hammac, Pineview, Osaka, Wallace, Stanley Crossroads, Barnett Crossroads, Sardine, Welka and Wahl. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING
